meanings.def: a statement that a person makes, admitting that they are guilty of a crime; the act of making such a statement
examples: After hours of questioning by police, she made a full confession.
His confession was extracted under torture.
It's difficult to believe it's a true confession after all her lies.
She made a false confession during the trial which she later retracted.
The court excluded the confession wrongly obtained by the police.
The police forced a confession out of him.
a true confession of a terrible crime
an alleged confession by the defendant

meanings.def: a statement admitting something that you are ashamed or embarrassed about; the act of making such a statement
examples: I've a confession to make—I lied about my age.
I have a confession to make. I read your private emails.
The government made open confession of its inability to cope with the crisis.

meanings.def: a private statement to a priest about the bad things that you have done; an occasion when you make such a statement
examples: The priest heard her confession and granted absolution.
I used to go to confession every Saturday as a child.

meanings.def: a statement of your religious beliefs, principles, etc.
